title: Symposium: The Way of the Vessel—Making, Collecting, and Disseminating Chinese Bronzes
hero_caption: <p><em>Pedestalled Tureen of Duke Ju (Bo Ju Gui)</em>, Western Zhou dynasty, 1046-771 BC. China. Xiling Collection.</p>
short_description: Presented with the University of Chicago
list_description: Presented with the University of Chicago
description:
In conjunction with Mirroring China’s Past: Emperors and Their Bronzes, the museum and the University of Chicago present a symposium exploring the cultural practices surrounding ancient bronzes, both in their original context and later as revered objects collected by emperors and scholars.
